info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rawlins and northern Decatur Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 417 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Danbury to 9 miles southeast of Atwood. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Rawlins and northern Decatur Counties, including the following locations... Traer and Cedar Bluffs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
